author: Special Correspondent
text:
Parents should restrict the amount of time young children spend with computers and phones, Mata Amritanandamayi, spiritual leader, said here on Thursday.

Addressing a huge gathering of devotees at the at Tagore Arts College Grounds, Mata Amritanandamayi, who reached here on Wednesday evening as part of her south Indian tour, said that the younger generation was facing the danger of indiscriminate pursuit of so-called sophistication, while forgetting one’s culture.

“To keep children from bothering them, many parents buy them smart phones and tablets. This results in the children quickly falling slave to these gadgets,” she said.

She said that in many countries, thousands of youngsters withdrew into a shell because of addiction to their gadgets and then ended up with mental problems.

“Gadgets can be useful educational tools, but parents and teachers must ensure that their use is not harmful, by using proper surveillance. Also, parents should restrict the amount of time young children spend with computers and phones,” she said.

She also said that education should not be limited to a few pieces of information transferred from the teacher’s brain to the student’s. “Information should grow to become knowledge; knowledge should grow to become proper discernment,” she said. Earlier, welcoming her, Congress president A. Namassivayam urged her to set up a medical college and a university in Puducherry.
title: ‘Enslaved by gadgets, youngsters forget culture’
